states.label: Licensed Professional Status
states.definition: The condition of holding a valid professional engineering license authorizing practice

states.label: Mentor Unavailability
states.definition: The state where a previously available mentor or supervisor is no longer accessible for guidance
states.source_text: Engineer B recently retired and was no longer available to Engineer A in a work capacity

states.label: Technical Writing Uncertainty
states.definition: A state of reduced confidence in one's ability to produce professional technical documentation
states.source_text: personally, less confident in their technical writing

states.label: Tool Inexperience
states.definition: The state of lacking prior practical experience with a specific software tool or technology
states.source_text: The AI drafting software was new to the market and Engineer A had no previous experience with the tool

states.label: Draft Status
states.definition: The state of a document being preliminary and subject to revision before final approval
states.source_text: clearly identify that the supplied report was a draft

states.label: Client Concern
states.definition: A state where the client has identified issues and expressed doubt about deliverable quality
states.source_text: Client W raised concerns about the accuracy and reliability of the engineering design

states.label: Regulatory Non-compliance
states.definition: The state of a design or document failing to meet required regulatory standards
states.source_text: omission of key safety features required by local regulations
